name: Lockpicking Kit
description:
I've been dreaming of a Refractor Kit deck since the Overdrive spoilers came out. This is my attempt to build one.

The Akamatsu Mem Chip is going to become an Astrolabe as soon as the card is released.

name: Chaos Blitz
description: Basically the point of this deck is to win and blitz through your stack. Obviously its focused on seeing the Corps cards before they do

name: Kate Covert Ops
description:
This deck has had great success in our current league although takes a bit of practice to adjust to. It runs extremely economically and it needs to! The key strategy is to draw heavy and establish R&D lock early creating a race to win situation.

The first 4-5 turns are important you need to draw at least once every turn and play a piece of Hardware or Program maximising Kate’s ability. Pro-Co is gold and don’t hesitate to first turn play it then use it to draw then play a 1-cost hardware for free then an SMC (my favourite opening).

It doesn’t hurt to check the first few pieces of ICE against FA decks which are the hardest matchup to force them to rez but don’t waste your resources on trashing unless it can’t be avoided. You need breakers super quick so draw more than usual to keep up.

Once you have an SMC out you can grab the appropriate breaker and this deck will reach a point where you can run for ‘free’ once every turn maybe twice. I often use Clone Chip on SMC to get the next breaker as needed.

Modded I usually save to play the R&D interfaces and only burn it to get out Dagger/Shiv/Plascrete when it seems necessary.

Drawbacks are lack of multi access on HQ. Making one solid run each turn which is usually R&D becomes much better with multi access. Then once you have established decent lock start sniping HQ or the remotes. Try and flush some agendas out.

Changes: • Against PE/RP decks I have been using Feedback Filter instead of the 3rd Lockpick with some success. Sometimes just preventing 1 net damage will keep you alive and of course being able to check traps and prevent brain Damage is a great backup ability. • I have considered trading Special Order for Parasite or HQ Interface it deserves further testing. • Using Shiv instead of Dagger is a personal choice they both have benefits and drawbacks. • Corroder seems better in most cases over Blackcat so far in testing although Corroder uses more ‘real’ money for larger barriers.

The fiscal nature of this style requires practice and being aware which pieces need to come out first. That may not appeal to all players but I’d love to hear back any feedback or modifications?

name: Planned Chaos 1.1
The Heinlein Manoeuvre
description:
Firstly let me say this is not a tournament deck this is a league night deck as it requires several extra turns to win. I made it to obtain the achievement of winning with 30 credits in the bank which it did effortlessly. This is a as you can see a glacier deck capable of scoring out 3 point agendas in relative safety and has a very good win rate with added bonus of fun to play.

The initial setup will naturally depend on your opening hand but the classic opening start is Victor 1.0 (or Viper) and a Heinlein Grid on R&D or HQ. Once the runner initiates the run rez HG in the appropriate window and watch the runner decide whether to take a brain damage or lose all their money. Once the runner begins playing breakers then Ichi is another ICE that works well with HG.

Surviving the first few turns which is the weakest stage of this deck is crucial and most likely where you will lose the game due to those big fat 3 point agendas up for grabs. After that you should be ok. I have been 5 agenda points’ down but once I hit mid game was able to lock the runner out and easily win.

The early to mid-game involves cards like Encryption Login Protocol and The Root. Always protect The Root it is gold in this deck. I use it to rez Adonis and Eves to offset the initial loss, to place ICE 2-3 deep and still make a credit off my ID, not to mention advancing agendas and rezzing. Once The Root is safely up my cash usually leaps forward 10-20 credits very quickly. Archived Memories is nearly always used to bring it back or if they ignore it then ELP or ASH is next best choice (same for Jackson).

It is then a process of setting up your scoring server which I usually begin over an Adonis. As the Adonis ticks down I begin placing Tollbooth, Ash, Heimdal etc.

Changes: • I would consider changing Neural Katana I usually place it on Archives in case of Security Testing but it could easily be any other 2 INF ICE for a surprise. • I would love another ASH and the one card I have considered trying to squeeze in as it can be a game breaker.

If anyone plays this let me know I would love feedback and thoughts on any way to improve further?

name: Stronger money
description: I wanted to make stronger together and wanted to make it work so dumped tonnes of money into deck

Kate and Friends
description: Just putting this out there for public comment.

Bonsai

My first corp deck, not really based of any particular deck but just on cards i like or want to try.

Advice?

name: Caprice is Making the News
NBN - Fast Advance
AC/DC siphon
Déjà Vu @ Duggar's
description:
I had this deck played against me and it was really interesting. Sorry can't remember the player name to give credit.

Actual card values might need tweaking further but this seemed to be the guts of it.

Get the hand size limit up with Origami & BOX-E, start the virus mill until Duggar's turns up and Infiltration any installed looking Agendas.

Frame Job to get Blackmail working and then Same Old Thing everything as required.

Levy AR Lab Access to start the process all again.

Seems Noise just doesn't learn his lessons at Duggar's.

name: mn tax
If you run, I will find you.
description:
The main idea of the deck is to make the runner run recklessly and either eat a couple of Scorched Earth in the face or an Information Overload while having a good number of tags oh his/her person. When you manage to tag the runner enough you can even win with a over-advanced Project Beale. If your opponent isn't suspecting anything and is just expecting a fast advance then you almost certainly have him, barring some lucky agenda snipping, but even if your opponent knows the deck, then they know better to run recklessly, even if you don't have any traps. I've had very good results even in tournaments (no wins yet since, usually, my runner decks are not very good)

*Right now I'm testing to see if Targeted Marketing can be replaced with Manhunt

Hope you like it :)

name: First deck
Who Let The Dogs Out??
Caprice is Making the News
Gabe Testing
description: This is basically "how good can you get Gabe with only one core set?" Still a little bit under construction, the idea is to aggressively run HQ until it gets over iced, then switch to sneak door.

name: J:PE running bare
description: Ice the centrals and run the extremities bare.

name: Tag and score (Midway Station Grid)
description:
This is a Tag Hell deck based around Midway Station Grid and Manhunt. The goal is simple. Tax the runner as much as you can while forcing him to flot tags. If your remote is not safe anymore, start scoring out of hands with Psychographics. :)

All ICE have enough subroutines to make MSG worth it. Sensei gives ETR to pieces of ICE behind him and help a lot for those who doesn't normaly stop the runner.

name: Caprice is Making the News
Old Spooks Never Die
description:
Considering Quest Completed, Legwork, and/or Notoriety to replace (some of) Crypsis, Fall Guy, Femme, Keyhole.

Earlier iteration had just 3 Crypsis and a Femme for breakers, along with a 3rd Crescentus, 2nd data dealer, 1 Blackmail and 1 Running interference. Lacked NACH & central breakers.

name: Stealth Kit
description:
Inspired by @CodeMarvelous "Stealth Starter Kit" deck, this is my take in a stealth deck for Rielle Peddler. Less focused on running centrals and more focused on a fast rig assembly.

I'll try this out next weekend to see how it goes :)

name: Your Near-Earth Grave v3
description: Super porous deck, but you're playing more of a shell game, mostly going for some easy bluffed agenda scores, lots of tax and tag punishment, and a potential flatline with your response team and security force armies. Traffic Accident will probably go into this once Order and Chaos is released.

name: Quetzal's Favorite Passtime
description: Criticism welcome! I'm considering whether I want to try to make room for Ice Carvers, but I don't know what I'd drop.

name: Stronger Together Brain Melter
description: A brain damage deck based out of Stronger Together. Just putting together as a thought experiment.

name: Punitive Awakening
description: Just an idea I'm testing.

name: No thanks, black cat.

Deus X against Jin

Paint big barrier than slice with dagger... just backup plan, though.

name: Quetman...?

name: The Santa Maria 2.0
description: Blue Sun glacier tuned to try and get out of the early game, once you start getting cash everything just starts to snowball. You should be getting at least 3 credits or a bad pub removal from your ID nearly every turn.

name: Double Expresso
description: I promise it's better than it looks. Very fast, all the money. Could definitely be improved though. Lawyer up and the siphons are the cards I find least useful.

name: Unlimited Cosmic Power
Unlimited Cosmic Power 1.1
description: http://self-modifyingcode.com/

name: Supreme Godess Deck
description:
The idea behind this deck is to get your 3 Mother Goddess as quickly as possible, so you can protect R&D, HQ and an external server real quick, by using your identity (The Foundry: Refining the Process).

Levy University and the combo Domestic Sleepers + Aggressive Negotiation are your primary tools to the godesses.

On the other hand, to get a Godess or a tutor card / combo real quick you will use Anonymous Tip, Blue Level Clearance and Green Level Clearance. Jackson Howard can help too.

Your economy will be based upon Gila Hands Arcology, Profiteering and Hedge Fund.

When playing against a runner that can trash your ICE (Anarch mainly, with parasites for example), you can use Jackson Howard, Reclamation Order, Interns and Archived Memories.

The Cerebral Overwriter is just there to throw the runner off course, should he dive hungrily to get it.

If you struggle to find your first Godess, you will probably mill some cards from R&D, and you can find yourself with lots of agendas in your hand. Try to hold on to them as long as possible until you can safely thrash them when you have Jackson Howard installed, remove and reshuffle them into R&D.

name: Full damage ambush jinteki
description:
Play horizontally. Advance your agendas and ambushes. Make lethal combos, for example: Whirlpool + Neural Katana + Snare!.

Your economy is financed by Beanstalk Royalties and Hedge Fund.

name: House of Blues
description: Built with House of Cards in mind. Focused on getting a large economy and shutting the runner out. Being able to rez very large ice quickly plus the threat of punitive and power shutdown is painful.

name: Full Bioroid
Nobody expects the HB Inquisition!
description:
playing only 5/3 agendas you have a significant advantage: you only need to score 2 of them plus Domestic Sleepers while the Runner has to steal 3 agendas other than DS. This is basically a glacier deck that can build a strong scoring server taking advantage of the low agenda density. In addition, the deck has an alternative winning condition with Punitive Counterstrike that many people don't expect in HB! 8-)

Runners will learn that amongst our weaponry are such diverse elements as fear, surprise and ruthless efficiency!

name: As Big As It Gets
description: Build It, then try shuffling it.

name: Whats a Plascrete?
description:
Blue Sun with a surprise kill Condition, Geothermal's allow me to get some nice cash flow when i have mills and if i don't see i can just opt to not use it.

Using OtG in place of where i see Ash would fit partially as it saves influence but also it means i only need to worry about HQ & R&D (maybe Archive too) stick it down your agenda and advance next turn return it and advance the agenda. also am running all 2 pointers as i don't like 3 pointers so OtG works fine for this setup.
